snippet: Flood damage from California's New Year storms is likely to top $1.8 billion, Gov. Pete Wilson said on Thursday as he ordered a speed-up in levee repairs and the installation of new river-monitoring stations.    A special flood emergency action te...
lead_paragraph: Flood damage from California's New Year storms is likely to top $1.8 billion, Gov. Pete Wilson said on Thursday as he ordered a speed-up in levee repairs and the installation of new river-monitoring stations. A special flood emergency action team established last month by Mr. Wilson issued a 30-day status report that identified hundreds of millions of dollars in losses across the northern and central parts of the state.
abstract: Gov Pete Wilson says flood damage from California's New Year storms is likely to exceed $1.8 billion; orders speed-up in levee repairs (S)

headline.main: California Flood Damage May Exceed $1.8 Billion
